comments:
Build M5

I tried to import a plugin from the file system.  I chose 'Choose plug-ins in 
the runtime platform' and 'Copy plug-in contents to the workspace location'.  
When I clicked on next an error dialog appeared.

It said '276'.

Once I dismissed the error dialog, a selection list appeared.  The list had 
many unchecked checkboxes, and none of them had any text next to them.

The following trace was in the .log file:


</log-entry>
<log-entry date="Fri Apr 19 17:51:31 EDT 2002">
  <status
     plugin-id="org.eclipse.pde.ui"
     severity="ERROR"
     message="276"
     code="0">
    <exception
       message="276"
       trace="
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 276
	at java.util.Vector.elementAt(Vector.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.ExternalModelManager.getFragment
(ExternalModelManager.java:140)
	at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportWizardDetailedPage$1.ru
n(PluginImportWizardDetailedPage.java:203)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
(ModalContext.java:98)
">
    </exception>
  </status>
</log-entry>

Created an attachment (id=671)
Snapshot of error dialog

More info - it turns out that if I scroll down the list I eventually do 
encounter some names.  Only the top 63 elements are empty.  If I check any of 
the 'empty' plugins, the counter (0 out of 338 selected) does not change.  If 
I click on a named element it does change.

It's also curious that I only seem to have 53 folders in my plugin folder (why 
338?)

I think that the problem is probably related to the Preferences->Plug-in 
Development->Target Platform->Locate non-workspace plug-ins... option.  I had 
this option set to point at an installation of WSADIE.  When I changed it back 
to 'This application', I was able to use the PDE import again.

The problem was related to existence of fragments in the build. I released the 
fix into HEAD today. It will appear in the next integration build (Tuesday).
